intro: Lipotriche pungens subsp. caudata, commonly known as the spiked lipotriche, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in forest understories. Its subspecific name, *caudata*, refers to the tail-like appearance of its leaves.
